 17 
 18 /**
 19  * @namespace A unique namespace inside jQuery.
 20  */
 21 jQuery.solrjs = function() {};
 22 
 23 
 24 /** 
 25  * A static "constructor" method that creates widget classes.
 26  *
 27  * <p> It uses manual jquery inheritance inspired by 
 28  * http://groups.google.com/group/jquery-dev/msg/12d01b62c2f30671' </p>
 29  * 
 30  * @param baseClass The name of the parent class. Set null to create a top level class. 
 31  * @param subClass The fields and methods of the new class.
 32  * @returns A constructor method that represents the new class. 
 33  * 
 34  * @example
 35  *   jQuery.solrjs.MyClass = jQuery.solrjs.createClass ("MyBaseClass", {
 36  *      property1: "value",
 37  *      function1: function() { alert("Hello World") }
 38  *   });
 39  *
 40  * 
 41  */
 42 jQuery.solrjs.createClass = function(baseClassName, subClass) {
 43 		
 44 	// create new class, adding the constructor 
 45   var newClass = jQuery.extend(true, subClass , {	
 46 
 47 		constructor : function(options) {
 48 			// if a baseclass is specified, inherit methods and props, and store it in _super_			
 49 			if (baseClassName != null) { 
 50 	    	jQuery.extend(true, this, new jQuery.solrjs[baseClassName](options) );
 51 			}
 52 			// add new methods and props for this class
 53 		  jQuery.extend(true, this , subClass);
 54       // add constructor arguments	    
 55 			jQuery.extend(true, this, options); 
 56   	}
 57 	});
 58 	
 59 	// make new class accessible
 60 	return newClass.constructor;
 61 
 62 };
 63
